title: 3Sum Closest - Array - Medium - LeetCode
content:

title: Largest Substring Between Two Equal Characters - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content: Given a string s, return the length of the longest substring between two equal characters, excluding the two characters. If there is no such substring return -1. A substring is a contiguous sequence of characters within a string.   Example 1: Input: s = "aa"

title: Special Array With X Elements Greater Than or Equal X - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:

title: Shortest Distance to a Character - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given a string S and a character C, return an array of integers representing the shortest distance from the character C in the string. Example 1: Input: S = "loveleetcode", C = 'e'
Output: [3, 2, 1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 1, 2, 2, 1, 0]

title: Relative Ranks - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given scores of N athletes, find their relative ranks and the people with the top three highest scores, who will be awarded medals: "Gold Medal", "Silver Medal" and "Bronze Medal". Example 1:
Input: [5, 4, 3, 2, 1]
Output: ["Gold Medal", "Silver Medal", "Bronze Medal", "4", "5"]<

title: Sum of All Odd Length Subarrays - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given an array of positive integers arr, calculate the sum of all possible odd-length subarrays. A subarray is a contiguous subsequence of the array. Return the sum of all odd-length subarrays of arr.   Example 1: Input: arr = [1,4,2,5,3]
Output: 58

title: Special Positions in a Binary Matrix - Array - Easy - LeetCode
content:
Given a rows x cols matrix mat, where mat[i][j] is either 0 or 1, return the number of special positions in mat.
A position (i,j) is called special if mat[i][j] == 1 and all other elements in row i and column j are 0 (rows and columns are 0-indexed).
